main.docTitle:
Bond Fund
Resolution of the Legislative Council
main.text: Resolution made and passed by the Legislative Council under section 29 of the Public Finance Ordinance (Cap. 2) on 8 July 2009.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is established a fund to be known as the “Bond Fund” in English and “債券基金” in Chinese;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: the following are to be credited to the Fund—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: sums borrowed under section 3 of the Loans Ordinance (Cap. 61) that are required to be credited to the Fund by any resolution of the Legislative Council approving the borrowing;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sums received by way of interest, dividends or investment income earned in respect of the sums held in the Fund;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any appropriations from the general revenue that may be approved by the Legislative Council;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any other sums that may be received for the purposes of the Fund;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: earnings from interest or dividends on investments of the Fund are to be retained for the purposes of the Fund;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the Financial Secretary may expend money from the Fund for the purposes of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: repaying or, if appropriate, paying the principal of, interest on, and expenses incurred in relation to, any sums that have been borrowed under section 3 of the Loans Ordinance (Cap. 61) for the purposes of the Fund; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.leadIn: for sums borrowed in the manner mentioned in section 2A of the Loans Ordinance (Cap. 61), the power under paragraph (e) includes—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: paying the sums referred to in subsection (1)(e) of that section; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: paying the expenses incurred in relation to the borrowing; (7 of 2014 s. 7)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Director of Accounting Services, under the authority of a funds warrant issued by the Financial Secretary, is to pay from the Fund any sums that may be required to meet expenditures from the Fund; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary may transfer from the Fund to the general revenue the balance held in the Fund, if so approved by the Legislative Council, when all financial obligations and liabilities are met in relation to any sums that have been borrowed under section 3 of the Loans Ordinance (Cap. 61) for the purposes of the Fund.
